Figure 2a, b show historical observed regional annual T and P from the Climate Research Unit (CRU)
32 , as well as individual GCMs’ projected changes in T and P relative to 1990. 90% confidence intervals (CIs) of GCM projections are developed using the Bayesian uncertainty approach, assuming the historical period is prior to 1990, and compared to CIs developed using a traditional democratic weighting. The Bayesian approach weights models based on how well they match historical observed changes in T and P (see Methods). The democratic approach assumes all models perform equally well
33 . Between these two methods, the Bayesian approach produces smaller CIs because it assigns more weight to a subset of models that best match historical change in this region.
